intro: Corysanthes ledermannii, commonly known as the Ledermann's corysanthes, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and restricted habitat, it is considered a rare and specialized species.
